groBot.entity

Class GroBots

  • java.lang.Object
    • groBot.entity.GroBots

  • public class GroBots
extends java.lang.Object
    Object representation of the GroBot This object contains the macAddress of the GroBot and allows the user to name the GroBot This Class also interacts with the hardware via THE INTERNET
    Author:
    conangammel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.Boolean airOn
      Boolean to tell the "status" page whether the air port is on or off.
      private java.lang.Boolean auxOn
      Boolean to tell the "status" page whether the auxiliary port is on or off.
      private Schedule currentSchedule
      The schedule that the GroBot is currently running.
      private java.lang.Long id
      An ID for unique storage in Objectify.
      private java.lang.Boolean lightOn
      Boolean to tell the "status" page whether the lights are on or off.
      private java.lang.String lightTimeRemaining
      String representation of the time remaining in the light cycle, or the time until the lights turn on next.
      private java.lang.String macAddress
      The unique MAC address of each microcontroller.
      private java.lang.String name
      User's name for the GroBot
      private java.lang.String ownerEmail
      Email address of the user who owns the GroBot
      private java.lang.Boolean waterOn
      Boolean to tell the "status" page whether the water port is on or off.
      private java.lang.String waterTimeRemaining
      String representation of the time remaining in the water cycle, or the time until the water turns on next.

    • Field Detail

      • airOn

        private java.lang.Boolean airOn
        Boolean to tell the "status" page whether the air port is on or off. This information comes from the microcontroller.

      • auxOn

        private java.lang.Boolean auxOn
        Boolean to tell the "status" page whether the auxiliary port is on or off. This information comes from the microcontroller.

      • currentSchedule

        private Schedule currentSchedule
        The schedule that the GroBot is currently running. Information from this schedule will be used to communicate schedules info to the microcontroller

      • id

        private java.lang.Long id
        An ID for unique storage in Objectify. HashCode of MAC address

      • lightOn

        private java.lang.Boolean lightOn
        Boolean to tell the "status" page whether the lights are on or off. This information comes from the microcontroller.

      • lightTimeRemaining

        private java.lang.String lightTimeRemaining
        String representation of the time remaining in the light cycle, or the time until the lights turn on next. This information comes from the microcontroller.

      • macAddress

        private java.lang.String macAddress
        The unique MAC address of each microcontroller. If brought to market, this would be in the instruction manual for users.

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        User's name for the GroBot

      • ownerEmail

        private java.lang.String ownerEmail
        Email address of the user who owns the GroBot

      • waterOn

        private java.lang.Boolean waterOn
        Boolean to tell the "status" page whether the water port is on or off. This information comes from the microcontroller.

      • waterTimeRemaining

        private java.lang.String waterTimeRemaining
        String representation of the time remaining in the water cycle, or the time until the water turns on next. This information comes from the microcontroller.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GroBots

        public GroBots()
        Default Constructor. Needed for Objectify. Each user gets this default GroBot until he/she adds a real GroBot with a MAC address.

      • GroBots

        public GroBots(java.lang.String name,
       java.lang.String add,
       java.lang.String owner)
        Constructor that takes a name, MAC address, and the owner's email address. Initializes the GroBot with a default schedule (avoids null pointer exception on the website). This schedule can be changed by the user by running a new schedule.
        Parameters:
        name -
        add -
        owner -
